```{r include = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(eval = FALSE, collapse = TRUE, comment = NA, tidy = FALSE)
```


There is a nice piece over at [Priceonomics](http://priceonomics.com/hadley-wickham-the-man-who-revolutionized-r/) on Hadley Wickham's contribution to R. I especially like the following quote from Hadley:

> The analyses that get me excited are not Google crunching a terabyte of web ad data in order to optimize revenue... [but rather] the biologists who are absolutely passionate about this one swampfly and now they can use R and they can understand it.
